indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. # of revised/updated regional strategies on energy efficiency drafted with LAs and public participation, approved by local councils and receiving funding for implementation 2. # of awareness raising campaigns/events on energy efficiency 3. # of community members and local/regional authorities trained on energy efficiency 4. # of technical documentation packages for local projects aimed at reducing energy consumption supported 5. # of community micro-projects implemented

baseline.comment: 1. The majority of Regional strategies on efficient energy use are not linked with budget allocations 2. Majority of rural population in Ukraine lack knowledge on energy saving options 3. Majority of active community members, local/regional authorities and recently elected officials lack skill in energy planning 4. The amount of energy consumption of the Ukrainian households is 3-7 times higher than the average in Europe. 5. Living condition in rural Ukraine is poor due to out of date worn out energy infrastructure

target.comment: 1) Target was 0; completed in 2013 2) at least 80 public events on raising awareness on energy efficiency are to be conducted; 3) at least 4000 participants including CO members and local authorities trained in energy planning and efficient energy use 4) Target was 0; completed in 2013 5) 82 micro projects on energy efficiency supported. 90 micro projects to be completed.

actual.comment: 1) Completed in 2013. In total up to the end of 2013, 6 regional strategies on efficient energy were updated. 2) 90 public events on raising public awareness on energy efficiency were conducted; 3) 4030 people, including community members and local/regional authorities trained in energy planning and efficient energy use (with 53% female representation) 4) Completed in 2013. In total up to the end of 2013, 6 regional strategies on efficient energy were updated. 5) 82 micro projects were approved for implementation. 93 micro projects were completed.

target.comment: 1) Target was 0; completed in 2013 2) 5 public events on raising public awareness on energy efficiency 3) 200 people (including community members and local authorities got information and basing knowledge on efficient energy use) 4) Target was 0; completed in 2013 5) 65 micro projects completed

actual.comment: 1) Target was 0; completed in 2013 2) 5 events on raising public awareness on energy efficiency were conducted 3) 237 community members, local authorities participated in the events (with 52% female representation) 4) Target was 0; completed in 2013 5) 65 micro projects on energy efficiency were completed

location.name: Poltava
location.description: seat of a first-order administrative division
location.activity-description: Support to the optimization of social services provision at the local level through advisory support to piloting of the model of integrated center on social services , development of recommendations on budgeting and administrative rearrangements for implementation of this model.

location.name: Kyiv
location.activity-description: Support the Government of Ukraine and the Ministry of Social Policy of Ukraine in accelerating the implementation of the reforms in social policy and achieving Ukraines short- and mid-term social and economic development goals.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Indicator 1: Number of legislative documents developed or amended Indicator 2: Number of strategic papers with recommendations prepared

baseline.comment: The reforms of the social sector although announced and declared have not been launched due to lack of capacity within the MSP to elaborate and implement them.

target.comment: Target 1: 2 normative documents developed or amended Target 2: 2 papers with recommendations prepared

actual.comment:
1.Total 6 legislative documents were developed or amended. - The Methodical recommendations for the organizations to inform the public about social services (adopted by the Order of Ministry of Social Policy of Ukraine No 828 as for 28 October 2014). - The Methodical recommendations on supervision in Social Services (adopted by the Order of Ministry of Social Policy of Ukraine No 5 as for 5 January 2015). - The State Standard on support families in difficult leaving situation. - The Methodical recommendations for specialist of social services on prevention and overcoming professional and emotional burn-out. - The proposals to the Interim Regulation on Integrated Center of Social Services (for piloting). - Regulation on Integrated Center of Social Services with structure and staffing.
2. 2 papers with recommendations prepared - Analytical Note with justification of creation of the Integrated Center of Social Services. - Methodical recommendations on providing of the first psychological aid for IDPs.
Additionaly: 551 representatives of regional departments of social protections, social services and volunteers were trained on the issues of management in social services, supervision, public awareness on social services, implementation the programme on preparation youth to family life, prevention burn-out, and first psychological aid for IDPs through a 20 seminars and trainings.
Manuals and booklet prepared and printed: - Road Map for IDPs with general information for protection IDPs. - Road Map for IDPs on employment of IDPs (1000 copies). - Road Map for IDPs with recommendations and contact information on psychological support (500 copies). - Road Map for IDPs with general updated information, with chapters added on monthly allowance and registration (1 000 copies). - The Methodical recommendations on providing of the first psychological aid for IDPs (1100 copies).

target.comment: Target 1: 2 normative documents developed or amended Target 2: 2 papers with recommendations prepared

actual.comment: 1.Total 1 normative document amended: - Recommendation to the draft low on employment was developed 2. Total 2 paper with recommendation were developed: - Recommendation on improvement of the voucher system - Recommendation to the draft Poverty Reduction Strategy

location.name: Kyiv
location.activity-description: Support the Ministry of Economic Development and Trade of Ukraine in acceleration of the progress towards the achievement of Millennium Development Goals through enhanced monitoring system, strengthened capacity in MDGs-based policy-making, planning and mainstreaming into sectoral strategies.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Number of regular MDG Monitoring Reports prepared and disseminated 2. Number of national and sector development strategies/programmes/plans that incorporate/ are based on MDGs targets and indicators 3. Number of regions that institutionalized MDGs and prepared and disseminated regional reports 4. Number of advocacy activities and events on MDGs, human development, social inclusion and quality of life conducted

baseline.comment: 1. There is weak capacity and lack of technical skills to regularly monitor the national MDGs progress, and to ensure the preparation of the regular reports in accordance with international requirements 2. Often changes in strategic priorities do not ensure adequate incorporation of MDGs into national and sector development strategies 3. MDGs are localized only in 3 regions of Ukraine 4. There is still a low level of awareness about MDGs targets and indicators

target.comment: - at least one MDG Monitoring Report prepared and disseminated - at least 3 national and sector development strategies/programmes/plans that incorporate/ are based on MDGs targets and indicators - at least 1 region that institutionalized MDGs and prepared and disseminated regional reports - at least 5 advocacy activities and events on MDGs, human development, social inclusion and quality of life conducted

actual.comment:
1. Monitoring report MDGs. Ukraine 2014 was prepared, presented and distributed. Transparent process of MDGs monitoring was organised.
2. MDGs targets and indicators have been incorporating into state policy documents. MDGs/SDGs were discussed during Research Conference on modernization of the model of economy in Ukraine, Consensus Forecast Seminars (3 issues of analytical note Ukraine: Prospects of development published and distributed).
3. MDGs/Post 2015 reports were distributed in Kiev and Lviv regions as start point for discussion.
4. 12 advocacy activities and events were conducted. Presentation of the 2014 Human Development Report with participation of the top officials (Vice Prime Minister of Ukraine, two Ministers etc) was successfully conducted. Open discussion panel on enhancing of human capital in Ukraine led by the Minister of Economic Development and Trade of Ukraine conducted. A number of advocacy activities and events were conducted, among them: 2 seminars for mass media on MDGs, sustainable development of Ukraine based on green inclusive growth and human development (2014 HDR), 2 round tables and 1 research conference on new poverty in Ukraine. 3 events devoted to the International Poverty Eradication Day were organized: Press Conference, Seminar/Practicum on poverty reduction for regional mass media from all oblasts of Ukraine, Award ceremony of Photo contest of Newspaper Day (17 October). MDGs advocacy campaign was successfully conducted: special nominations on MDGs were introduced in the framework of: (i) Newspaper Day photo contest, (ii) Contest for professional publicists, (iii) Student contest of social advertising. As a result more then 800 photos/150 articles on MDGs were published. Seminar/Practicum for young journalists-participants of Summer school of newspaper Day was conducted. 2 Lections on MDGs/Post 2015 and 2014 HDR and practical seminar on SDGs were delivered to the participants of UN Summer school. During the UN

target.comment: - at least 1 MDGs Progress Report prepared and disseminated - at least 2 national and sector development strategies/ programmes/plans that incorporate/ are based on MDGs targets and indicators - at least 1 region that MDGs Report disseminated and new goals (SDGs/Post 2015) discussed; - at least 8 advocacy activities and events on MDGs, human development, social inclusion and quality of life conducted

actual.comment:
1. Transparent process of producing the National Report MDGs. Ukraine: 2000-2015 has been started (150 experts from Government, academia, NGOs involved).
2. MDGs targets and indicators incorporated into the state policy documents; 17 SDGs and 169 targets discussed during Research Conference on modernization of the model of economy in Ukraine; Consensus Macroeconomic Forecast Seminars conducted (2 follow up issues Ukraine: Prospects of development published and distributed).
4. more then 20 advocacy activities and events were conducted, among them: presentation of the global 2015 MDGs Report for mass media, presentation of the draft National 2015 MDGs Report for expert community, 7 expert discussions on MDGs, 8 round tables on MDGs, 2 expert discussions on updating the Law on strategic planning, All Ukrainian Forum New challenges and opportunities of Ukraine in the framework of association with the European Union devoted to the World Day of Social Justice, 2 Lectures on MDGs/Post 2015 for students etc.

location.name: Kyiv
location.activity-description: Support the Government of Ukraine in enhancing links between HIV/AIDS responses and the broader MDG and development agendas.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1.Sustainability strategy with explicit set of actions developed and approved by all the key stakeholders. 2.1. National Cost Reduction Strategy presented and transferred into ownership of HIV medication purchasers for the national budget funds and 2.2. Government Decree on compulsory licensing operationalized.

baseline.comment: 1. Inadequate level of strategic planning and coordination between responsible stakeholders to assure sustainability of HIV/AIDS response. 2. High cost of essential treatment purchased for the national budget funds.

target.comment: 1.Sustainability strategy developed and approved by the key stakeholders 2.1.National Cost Reduction Strategy integrated into plans of HIV medication purchasers for the national budget funds and 2.2.at least 1 compulsory license issued

actual.comment: 1. National partners and government institutions were supported by development and incorporation of Concept Strategy for Sustainability of AIDS Service in Ukraine. Together with preparation and submission of GF NFM proposal these actions contributed to the sustainability of national HIV/AIDS Programms. 2.1. National Cost Reduction Strategy was incorporated into National ARV Strategy that has been adopted by HIV State Service. 2.2. The GoU Decree #877 on compulsory licensing has been discussed with main stakeholders. National legislation has been reviewed and amended in order to start issuing compulsory licenses.

target.comment: - One sustainability strategy developed by the end of 2015 - At least three intermediate reports on investment case study completed - List of normative acts prepared and table of amendments to GOU Decree #877 completed

actual.comment: Semi-annual result: - The UNDP JPMS 2014 was developed and downloaded to the online system under the leadership of UNAIDS. The inputs to the JPM2015 were provided to UNAIDS and discussed at the seminar that has been organized by UNAIDS for UNJT. - The inputs have been provided for developing the ToR for analyzing the possible scenarios of sustainability strategy where the projects made inputs in Care and support section. - National Technical Meeting on Access to Essential Medicines and Intellectual Property Aspects: Opportunities for Reform and Optimization was supported together with UNDP RO on June 2-3 in Kiev. The agenda, concept note of the meeting, list of participants, presentations, international experts and facilitation were provided by UNDP to the All-Ukrainian network of PLWH. - The national round table of Accesses to service of HIV positive adolescents within the reduction of the Global Fund funding was supported. A presentation on main recommendations from the gap analyses of national youth legislation was conducted (with focus on AIDS and health) on April 28 in UN House in Kiev.

location.name: Chuhuyiv
location.description: seat of a second-order administrative division

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Indicator 1. Assessments of existing capacity and barriers in environment, processes, products and services for persons with disabilities in selected two rayons. Indicator 2. Local strategies and action plans to address the accessibility issues in service delivery. Indicator 3. Community initiatives in key areas (employment, health care and social services).

target.comment: Target 1: 2 assessments of existing capacity and barriers in environment, processes, products and services for persons with disabilities in selected two rayons Target 2: 2 Local strategies/ action plans to address the accessibility issues in service delivery developed Target 3: min 4 community initiatives in key areas (employment, health care and social services) designed / elaborated and endorsed for implementation

actual.comment:
Two local Strategies and Action Plans to address the accessibility issues in service delivery are developed. Over 150 people, stakeholders from Kharkiv, Valky rayon and the town of Chuhuyiv, have been trained about Universal Design and Accessibility and Universal Design and Employment. 20 representatives from communities of Chuhuyiv and Valky rayon took part in a training devoted to fundraising, community engagement and project management conducted on 13-14 March 2014. Strategies and Action Plans for creation of accessible environment for all were developed by community members in Chuhuyiv and Valky rayon and include detailed Action Plans.
Three community initiatives in key areas (healthcare, social services and education) are in the process of implementation. Employment related initiative has been transferred to the national level.
School for Everyone Pilot initiative School for everyone in the town of Chuhuyiv is being implemented, with the accessibility audit conducted. Architectural Project for creation of accessibility at a school # 8 in Chuhuyiv has been created. The construction works in school # 8 are in process and to be completed in February 2015. Manual for school teachers on how to work with children with different disabilities or functional limitations has been developed. A two-day workshop Inclusive Education: Theory and Practice was held in the town of Chuhuyiv and gathered over 25 school teachers and psychologists.
Early Intervention UNDP jointly with UNICEF and local authorities have started implementation of the pilot initiatives on early intervention (habilitation services for children 0-4) in Chuhuyiv town and Valky rayon. Series of trainings for medical teams were organised on different issues of provision of services to children age 0-4 who are in need of services of speech therapist, physical rehabilitation specialist, etc.
Access to quality medical services for all women(Chuhuyiv)
UNDP jointly with WHO is work

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
1. % of planned oversight activities completed with documented participation by all CCM constituencies
2. % of key CCM documents completed and shared with all members
3. % of impact/outcome indicators in Global Fund grants that are consistent with impact/outcome indicators in national strategy documents

baseline.comment:
1. 17% of planned oversight activities completed with documented participation by all CCM constituencies
2. 67% of key CCM documents completed and shared with all members
3. 8% of impact/outcome indicators in Global Fund grants that are consistent with impact/outcome indicators in national strategy documents

target.comment: Target 1: 100% Target 2: 100% Target 3: 100%

actual.comment: Target 1: 100% 100% of planned oversight activities completed with documented participation by all CCM constituencies. There were implemented 18 activities during second year: 3 meetings of NTHC (15.01.2014, 12.06.2014, 28.10.2014) 2 meetings of the Oversight Commission (30.01.2014, 28.11.2014) 1 working meeting with the Oversight Commission and the State Service of the Social diseases for analyze the efficiency of GFATM grants implementation by Principal Recipients (PRs) and to prepare recommendations for PRs to ensure the effective use of Global Fund (10.09.2014) 1 working meeting with the Oversight Commission members and representatives of Global Fund regarding to preparing Concept Note of Ukraine in conditions of the new finance mechanism of Global Fund (17.09.2014) 1 training for the Oversight Commission members (29.04.2014) 1 working meeting with PRs and representatives of Global Fund on issues related to the political situation in regions (08.05.2014) 3 oversight visits (the city of Kyiv, Mykolaiv and Chernivtsi oblast) 1 training for the regional TB/HIV Councils (30.09-02.10.2014) 2 training modules involving representatives of the TB and HIV regional councils (head doctors of the AIDS centers, phtisiatricians) and representatives of the regional mass media on the need in the reform in health system and its implications were conducted (2-3.07.2014, 9-10.07.2014) 3 stakeholders meetings with CCM members, Oversight Commission members and representatives of Global Fund regarding to preparing Concept Note of Ukraine in conditions of the new finance mechanism of Global Fund (26.03.2014, 06.06.2014 and 16.09.2014) Altogether during the reporting period 18 out of 18 activities were conducted. Target 2: 100% 100% of key CCM documents completed and shared with all members: Three main documents were developed and approved at the meetings of the National TB and HIV Council: on 12 June 2014 - CCM Oversight Plan for 2014; 15 January 2014 - The National TB and HIV Co

target.comment: Baseline: 1. 89% of kay CCM documents completed and shared with all members 2. 25% planned oversight activities completed with documented participation by all CCM constituencies 3. 17% of planned communication activities completed by CCM to engage constituencies Indicators: 1. % of key CCM documents completed and shared with all members 2. % of planned oversight activities completed with documented participation by all CCM constituencies 3. % of planned communication activities completed by CCM to engage constituencies Targets: 1. 100% 2. 100% 3. 100%

actual.comment: 100 % of key CCM documents completed and shared with all members: Oversight plan on 2015 year was developed, was approved on CCM meeting on 24.02.2015 and shared (http://www.moz.gov.ua/ua/portal/tha_sv_6.4) 47 % of planned oversight activities completed with documented participation by all CCM constituencies: Was organized and conducted: 3 CCM meetings (26.02, 16.06, 24.09); 2 Oversight Commission meetings (29.05, 11.09); 2 meetings of the Oversight Commission with the PRs (23.06, 10.09); 1 meeting of the Oversight Commission with the Global Found representatives (10.06); 1 site visit of the CCM and the Oversight Commission members (24.06); 1 meeting with training elements in Kyiv for members of the regional TB and HIV councils (29.09-01.10) Was prepared 3 reports with analysis of the efficiency of the Global Fund grant performance by the PRs; 3 reports with the data collection, Dashboard feeding and analysis 44 % of planned communication activities completed by CCM to engage constituencies: Was organized and conducted: 5 meetings of the Committee on Program Issues and Committee on Regional Policy (12.02, 05.03, 12.03, 07.04, 17.06); 2 meetings of the stakeholders' representatives to discuss and improve TB and HIV/AIDS programs management both at the national and regional levels (Working Group of Sustainability) (27.08, 11.09); 1 meeting with training elements for representatives of the regional councils, representatives of relevant health care facilities responsible for internal and external communication at sites, on building up the effective communication model at the regional council level to improve involvement of the civic society representatives to the program management (08-09.07)

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Indicators: 1. Number of engineering designs of social services undertaken 2. Number of social care infrastructures renovated based on universal design principles and operational 3. Number of schools where water, sanitation and hygiene facilitates improved 4. Number of representatives of regional authorities trained on planning and management of social care services 5. Number of regional plans for the development of social care services elaborated and approved 6. Number of representatives of social care services institutions trained on provision of quality, targeted and integrated social services 7. Number of social care institutions equipped to deliver quality social care services

baseline.comment: Baseline: 1. 0 engineering designs of social services undertaken 2. 0 social care infrastructures renovated based on universal design principles and operational 3. 0 schools where water, sanitation and hygiene facilitates improved 4. 0 representatives of regional authorities trained on planning and management of social care services 5. 0 regional plans for the development of social care services elaborated and approved 6. 0 representatives of social care services institutions trained on provision of quality, targeted and integrated social services 7. 0 social care institutions equipped to deliver quality social care services

target.comment: Operationally the Project will start in January 2015

actual.comment: Project started in 2015

target.comment: 1. at least 15 engineering designs of social services undertaken 2. at least 15 social care infrastructures renovated based on universal design principles and operational 3. at least 10 schools where water, sanitation and hygiene facilitates improved 4. at least 20 representatives of regional authorities trained on planning and management of social care services 5. at least 5 regional plans for the development of social care services elaborated and approved 6. at least 45 representatives of social care services institutions trained on provision of quality, targeted and integrated social services 7. at least 15 social care institutions equipped to deliver quality social care services

actual.comment: 1. 21 engineering designs of social care institutions have been undertaken. 2. Rehabilitation works have started on 10 social care infrastructures. Construction companies were selected through open and transparent tender process. All engineering designs have passed the expertise on compliance to the universal design principles. 3. Rehabilitation works have started in 9 schools and 1 kindergarten. 4. 50 representatives of regional authorities have participated in trainings on planning and management of social care services. 5. 2 regional plans are in the process of elaboration with the local authorities. 6. 48 representatives of social care services institutions selected for trainings on provision of quality, targeted and integrated social services. 7. Specifications for rehabilitative equipment to be purchased have been developed

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1 Number of economic infrastructure facilities recovered 2. Number of people employed at cash for work, public works and temporary jobs programmes 3. Number of persons provided with new professions/ skills through trainings 4. Number of representatives of local administrations, PES trained 5. Number of business support institutions created and supported 6. Number of small and medium-sized businesses/enterprises started activities

target.comment: Project started in 2015

actual.comment: Project started in 2015

1. 12 infrastructure facilities selected and started to be recovered 2. 285 people employed at cash for work, public works and temporary jobs programmes (micro-capital agreements signed with 4 NGOs, 7 public institutions, and 9 private enterprises) 3. More than 300 interested persons selected and will get new business skills through a series of 12 5-day trainings, launched in Kramatorsk, Mariupol, and Severodonetsk cities 4. More than 50 representatives of local authorities are involved into participatory economic planning process (development of Strategy Implementation Plans) and provided with expert support and coaching 5. Business-Infrastructure Grant Programme launched in order to provide support to at least 10 business support institutions 6. Small Grants Program aimed to support start-ups and extension of existing small and micro businesses launched

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Baseline and no. of surveys on the publics perception of security. - No. of public awareness campaigns and materials on coping in a hostile (conflict-affected) environment. - No. of public awareness campaigns and materials on legal rights and remedies, as well as justice reform processes. - Assessments of impact of campaigns and materials.

baseline.comment: - Limited hard data on publics perception of security in conflict-affected areas; especially that of women. - Low public knowledge about risks posed by mines, UXOs, shelling, weapons proliferation, the heightened risk of SGBV or generally how to identify and respond to conflict-related security threats. - Poor public understanding of police, military, and security service operations in the conflict zone result in hostility, occasional security incidents, and a lack of coordination and cooperation. - Citizens have a poor understanding of their legal rights, as well as related procedures and remedies, and the role of justice and security institutions, which makes them less likely to assert their rights, vulnerable to abuse, and distrustful of authorities. - The public have little knowledge understanding of national justice sector reform processes, resulting in mistrust, resentment or impatience at the seeming lack of positive change at the local level.

target.comment: - Baseline survey conducted. - # citizens exposed to campaigns and materials on hostile environment awareness.- % increase in awareness amongst the targeted population. - # citizens exposed to campaigns and materials on legal rights and remedies, including justice reform processes, awareness. - % increase in awareness amongst the targeted population. - % increase in legal aid consultations in targeted communities.
